definition: hard pressed for money/in financial straits

sentences.english: One penurious year my parents used a swiss cheese plant.
sentences.chinese: 在經濟拮据的一年，我父母曾用繩狀藤來代替聖誕樹。

sentences.english: They were so hard pressed that they couldn't even pay the grocery bill.
sentences.chinese: 他們經濟很拮据，甚至付不出雜貨店的欠帳。

sentences.english: But previously, it was with unstinted means.
sentences.chinese: 可是以往的生活並不拮据。

sentences.english: So how do you budget for the Olympics during lean times?
sentences.chinese: 所以在經濟拮据時期，如何爲奧運會做預算呢？

sentences.english: He also confessed he had committed about 10 similar thefts because of financial problems.
sentences.chinese: 他還供認自己因經濟拮据曾犯下約10起類似盜竊案。

sentences.english: Some students' families are too poor to send their children to college.
sentences.chinese: 一些學生的家庭拮据供不起孩子上大學。

sentences.english: During staying in the state of Shang and Zhou, he was destitute down and out.
sentences.chinese: 在商與周兩地窮困潦倒，生活拮据。

sentences.english: Although she has become a celebrity, she still maintains an extremely frugal and sparing life.
sentences.chinese: 儘管她已成爲名人，卻仍然過着拮据寒磣的生活。

sentences.english: But these are lean times for Cusack.
sentences.chinese: 但是這是庫薩克的拮据時期。

sentences.english: The life resulting from frugality is so much happier than that resulting from shop-o-mania.
sentences.chinese: 節儉的生活要比拮据的生活快樂很多。

definition: tight (i.e. lacking money)/hard up/same as 緊巴巴|紧巴巴
to save on food and clothing (idiom); to live frugally
to economize on clothes and food/to scrimp and save (idiom)
Fuyu county in Qiqihar 齊齊哈爾|齐齐哈尔[Qi2 qi2 ha1 er3], Heilongjiang
to subsist/to eke out a living/to keep body and soul together
income does not cover expenditure/unable to make ends meet
to live frugally/to economize on food and clothing/to scrimp and save
